text:
Good Day, 
Has this issue which relates to the RCT (Change Block Tracking) while using
Veeam been fixed with the November Update 
Gen1 / Gen2 VMs backed up by Veeam using RCT (Change Block Tracking) 
edit: 19. Oct. 2023: clustered and unclustered VMs are affected 
Environment: 
vSphere 8.0 and ESXi 8.0 in a 2 node cluster 
Guest OS 2016

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] October patches
metadata.email_text_original:
Good Day, 
Has this issue which relates to the RCT (Change Block Tracking) while using
Veeam been fixed with the November Update 
Gen1 / Gen2 VMs backed up by Veeam using RCT (Change Block Tracking) 
edit: 19. Oct. 2023: clustered and unclustered VMs are affected 
Environment: 
vSphere 8.0 and ESXi 8.0 in a 2 node cluster 
Guest OS 2016 
From: 'Shimon Kerzner' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Monday, November 20, 2023 1:26 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] October patches 
There are reports that the RCT issue is fixed in November. 
https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/azure-stack/starting-vms-may-fail-after-installation-of-10-2023-cu-when/m-p/3956844/highlight/true
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fazure-stack%2Fstarting-vms-may-fail-after-installation-of-10-2023-cu-when%2Fm-p%2F3956844%2Fhighlight%2Ftrue&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4e6fc3d8916a4f31234108dbea0b7049%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638361107088468531%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2B68y5NsgZXZhaXz9TdmoEDSNpRuTWVaFIU1LrErGvns%3D&reserved=0] 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/1390624/virtual-machines-failed-to-start-after-installing?page=4#answers:~:text=Hi%20Dennis%2C%20it,0%20votes
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fanswers%2Fquestions%2F1390624%2Fvirtual-machines-failed-to-start-after-installing%3Fpage%3D4%23answers%3A~%3Atext%3DHi%2520Dennis%252C%2520it%2C0%2520votes&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4e6fc3d8916a4f31234108dbea0b7049%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638361107088468531%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ZTqJlXDtZUqSfHTLzkAmaN4ACYDUYpnDI8eBxw%2BS21Q%3D&reserved=0] 
Wish it was listed in the Update History though.
